comment.text: This translation key is used to display the label "New in folder" in a modal dialog header. It appears in the UI when a new file is added to a folder, providing a clear indication of the file's origin within that folder.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Uutta kansiossa" is understandable, a more natural and accurate translation of "New in folder" would be "Uusia kansiossa" or "Uutta kansiota". The original implies a plural, which "Uutta" doesn't quite convey effectively.

The translation "Նոր է թղթապանակում" (Nor e thg'tapanakum) literally translates to 'It is new in folder'. While understandable, it's not the most natural or idiomatic way to say 'New in folder' in Armenian. A more accurate and natural translation would emphasize the 'newness' within the folder, rather than just stating it exists there.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Նոր ֆայլեր թղթապանակում" (Nor fayler thg'tapanakum) - 'New files in folder', or "Թղթապանակում նոր" (Thg'tapanakum nor) - 'New in folder' (emphasizing the 'new').

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "フォルダに新しい項目" literally translates to "New items in folder." While understandable, "New in folder" implies a more immediate or recently added content. "フォルダに新しいファイル" would be a more accurate translation, emphasizing 'files'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: フォルダに新しいファイル

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "폴더의 새 항목" (Folder's new items) is too literal and doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'New in folder'. It suggests items *belonging to* a folder, rather than simply being new additions.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "새로 추가된 파일" (Newly added files) or "폴더 내 새로 고침" (Refresh in folder) to better convey the meaning.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation "​ໃບ​ໃສ່​ໂຟນເດີ" (bai sai folder) doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "New in folder." It translates more literally to "leaves in folder" or "placed in folder." A more accurate translation would depend on the context but something closer to "ລາຍການ​ໃໝ່​ໃນ​ໂຟນເດີ" (laikan mai nai folder - new items in folder) would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ລາຍການ​ໃໝ່​ໃນ​ໂຟນເດີ (laikan mai nai folder)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The initial zero-width space at the beginning of the Lao translation is unnecessary and might cause display issues.

The Sinhala translation "ෆෝල්ඩරයේ අලුතින් එක් කරන ලද්දක්" is a bit literal and not the most natural way to express "New in folder". It translates to something like "What was newly added to the folder". A more natural translation would be something like "නව ෆෝල්ඩර් පත්‍රිකைகள்" or "ෆෝල්ඩරයේ නවතම පත්‍රිකைகள்"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "නව ෆෝල්ඩර් පත්‍රිකைகள்" or "ෆෝල්ඩරයේ නවතම පත්‍රිකைகள்" for a more natural translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation "Нови у фасцикли" doesn't perfectly capture the nuance of "New in folder."  "Фасцикли" is more akin to 'folders' (plural) rather than 'in a folder'. A better translation would imply content *within* a folder.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Нови у директоријуми / Нови у новом фолдеру

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Novi u fascikli" is understandable, a more natural and accurate translation of "New in folder" would be "Novo u mapi" or "Novo u folderu". "Fascikli" is an older term and less commonly used in modern Serbian.

The translation '文件夹中新建' (Folder in New) doesn't quite capture the meaning of 'New in folder'. It implies creating a new item *within* the folder, rather than indicating what's *new* within the folder. A more accurate translation would be something like '文件夹内新增' or '文件夹更新'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 文件夹内新增 (Folder Newly Added) or 文件夹更新 (Folder Update)
